instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Chimes but no backlight. 3.3V on pins 2 and 3 and 40V on pins 21 and 22. Can this be a bad <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>?

No liquid damage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
40V means open LED strips.
Try full LCD assembly.
Be sure LCD connector is OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: 40v was with a tested full LCD assembly connected. LCD connector looks perfect

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
The correct voltage is aprox 25V.
40V means open LED strips!!!
There are 6 LED strips, each one 9 LEDs; one white LED requires aprox 2.7-3V.
Check all return resistors.
